title: What is the method of the handkerchief in hypnosis and what are the experiments conducted by Dr. Brémaud?
first_phrase: In this text, the author describes various experiments conducted by the French physician Dr. Brémaud in the late 19th century on the phenomenon of hypnosis. In the last 200 tokens, the author describes different methods used by the experimenter to induce hypnosis on various subjects, including the "Method of the Handshake," "Method of Counting," and "Method of the Handkerchief." Several examples are given of how the experimenter was able to control the subject's movements, words and thoughts using these methods, highlighting different symptoms of hypnosis. The names of the people and concepts such as Giovanni Aloia, Franco Cazzulani, and the "latah" syndrome from Malaysia mentioned in the text. The author warns against seeing these phenomena as supernormal, but rather as a scientific study of human suggestibility.
